questions.question: A scientist takes two samples of Earth's crust, each with a mass of 3240 grams. Sample A has density of 3.0 g/cm³, and sample B has a density of 2.7 g/cm³. How much greater is the volume, in cubic centimeters, of sample B than sample A?

The walls of a small apartment were covered using exactly 3 gallons of paint. The paint was spread uniformly over a total area of 960 square feet. What was the rate, in gallons per square foot, at which the paint was used?
The area of a rectangular region is increasing at a rate of 20 square feet per hour. Which of the following is closest to this rate in square meters per minute? (Use 1 meter = 3.28 feet)
questions.explanation: Convert 20 sq ft/hr to sq meters/min. $1 \text{ m} = 3.28 \text{ ft} \implies 1 \text{ sq m} = (3.28)^2 \text{ sq ft} = 10.7584 \text{ sq ft}$. Rate = $20 \text{ sq ft/hr} \times \frac{1 \text{ sq m}}{10.7584 \text{ sq ft}} \times \frac{1 \text{ hr}}{60 \text{ min}} = \frac{20}{10.7584 \times 60} = \frac{20}{645.5} \approx 0.031$.

questions.question: The speed of a white-throated needletail, a type of bird, in flight was measured to be 49 miles per hour. What was the white-throated needletail's measured speed, in kilometers per hour? (Use 1 mile = 1.61 kilometers)
The mass of a piece of iron is 454 grams. Given that 1 pound = 453.6 grams, what is the mass of the piece of iron in pounds?

A rectangle has a length of $x$ centimeters and a width of $y$ centimeters. If the area of the rectangle is 25 square inches, which equation represents the area of the rectangle in square centimeters? (1 inch = 2.54 centimeters)
questions.explanation: Area in sq cm = Area in sq in $\times (2.54)^2$. So $xy = 25(2.54)^2$.

questions.question: A certain medication is prescribed as 1 teaspoon every 4 hours. How many milliliters of medication are taken in one day? (1 teaspoon = 5 milliliters)
questions.explanation: One day = 24 hours. Doses per day = $24/4 = 6$. Total tsp = $6 \times 1 = 6$. Total ml = $6 \times 5 = 30$.

questions.question: The distance between two towns is 35 miles. What is this distance in kilometers? (1 mile = 1.61 kilometers)
The area of a rug is 36 square feet. What is the area of the rug in square yards? (1 yard = 3 feet)
questions.explanation: $1 \text{ sq yd} = 3^2 \text{ sq ft} = 9 \text{ sq ft}$. Area = $36 / 9 = 4$ sq yards.

questions.question: A car travels at a speed of 60 miles per hour. What is the speed in feet per second? (1 mile = 5280 feet)
The capacity of a fuel tank is 15 gallons. How many liters does the tank hold? (1 gallon = 3.79 liters)
A length of 254 centimeters is equivalent to how many inches? (1 inch = 2.54 centimeters)
A runner completes a 10-kilometer race in 40 minutes. What is the runner's average speed in kilometers per hour?
If a box has a volume of 2 cubic feet, what is the volume in cubic inches? (1 foot = 12 inches)
A recipe calls for 500 grams of flour. How many kilograms is this? (1 kilogram = 1000 grams)
The density of a substance is 2 grams per cubic centimeter. What is the density in kilograms per cubic meter? (1 kg = 1000 g, 1 m = 100 cm)
A car uses 8 liters of fuel to travel 100 kilometers. How many miles per gallon is this approximately? (1 mile = 1.61 km, 1 gallon = 3.79 liters)
questions.explanation: Fuel efficiency = Distance/Volume. Dist: $100 \text{ km} = 100/1.61 \text{ miles} \approx 62.11 \text{ miles}$. Vol: $8 \text{ L} = 8/3.79 \text{ gal} \approx 2.11 \text{ gal}$. MPG = $62.11 / 2.11 \approx 29.4$.

questions.question: An object moves at 10 meters per second. What is this speed in kilometers per hour?
The price of gold is \$60 per gram. What is the price per ounce? (1 ounce = 28.35 grams)
A storage tank has a volume of 0.84 cubic meters. What is the volume in quarts? (100 cm = 1 m, 946.35 cubic cm = 1 quart)
Bone mineral density is 0.812 g/cm². What is this in g/mm²? (1 cm = 10 mm)
Rate of speed increase is 1490 meters per hour per second. What is this in feet per second squared? (1 m = 3.28 ft)
questions.explanation: $1490 \text{ m/hr/s} = \frac{1490 \text{ m}}{1 \text{ hr} \cdot 1 \text{ s}} \times \frac{3.28 \text{ ft}}{1 \text{ m}} \times \frac{1 \text{ hr}}{3600 \text{ s}} = \frac{1490 \times 3.28}{3600} \text{ ft/s}^2 = \frac{4887.2}{3600} \approx 1.357$.

questions.question: A field has an area of 4047 square meters. How many acres is this? (1 acre = 4047 square meters)
How many centimeters are equivalent to 47 meters? (1 m = 100 cm)
An area of 56.00 square nautical miles is equivalent to $k$ square kilometers. Value of $k$? (1 nautical mile = 1.852 km)
questions.explanation: $1 \text{ sq naut mile} = (1.852)^2 \text{ sq km} \approx 3.4299$. Area = $56 \times 3.4299 \approx 192.07$. Rounded to tenth: 192.1.
